result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Kohlmann Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David J. Kohlmann Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David J. Kohlmann Jr was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • David J. Kohlmann Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

Defendant David J. Kohlmann in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of no contest to counts 1,2. State moves to dismiss count 3.  Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty and renders sentence.  Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.

Defendant David J. Kohlmann in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Def is eligible for public defender representation, will be appointed out.  Waive reading of felony complaint.    Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint. Def currently on probation hold. State requests $1000 cash bail with conditions.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
